How to Install mailgraph on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • mailgraph

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install mailgraph on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing mailgraph on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall mailgraph in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install mailgraph, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install mailgraph Using apt

To install mailgraph in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install mailgraph using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install mailgraph

The installation of mailgraph might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install mailgraph Using apt-get

To install mailgraph using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install mailgraph.

sudo apt-get -y install mailgraph

Install mailgraph Using Synaptic

To install mailgraph using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install mailgraph on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for mailgraph. This will display the mailgraph package in the package window, now to install mailgraph, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the mailgraph package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of mailgraph.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install mailgraph Using aptitude

To install mailgraph on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of mailgraph.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install mailgraph using the command aptitude install mailgraph.

sudo aptitude -y install mailgraph

How to Upgrade mailgraph on debian

If you want to upgrade the mailgraph package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade mailgraph using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade mailgraph to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade mailgraph.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade mailgraph sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade mailgraph

Upgrade mailgraph using Aptitude

To upgrade mailgraph using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade mailgraph.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade mailgraph

Upgrade mailgraph using Synaptic

To upgrade mailgraph using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for mailgraph, now right-click mailgraph, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade mailgraph just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall mailgraph on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall mailgraph from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just mailgraph, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove mailgraph

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of mailgraph

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of mailgraph you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge mailgraph

Remove mailgraph using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall mailgraph using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for mailgraph, right-click the mailgraph package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall mailgraph click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install mailgraph on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade mailgraph using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of mailgraph then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
